required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparative Study of Mammography and Ultrasound for Breast Cancer Screening and Early Diagnosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study of Mammography and Ultrasound for Breast Cancer Screening and Early Diagnosis

brief_summary.textblock: Improving the early diagnosis of breast cancer can reduce mortality. With mammography as the main tool for screening early breast cancer, the characteristics of dense breast and young onset of disease in Chinese women lowers the efficiency. The aim of this prospective study was to compare which method, x-ray or ultrasound, is more appropriate for screening and early diagnosis of breast cancer in Chinese women.

detailed_description.textblock: Breast cancer has become the most common malignancy in women. Improving the early diagnosis of breast cancer can reduce mortality. Mammography is recommended as the main tool for screening and early diagnosis of breast cancer in the guidelines of European and American countries. However, the characteristics of dense breast and young onset of disease in Chinese women make the screening and early diagnosis strategies of Western countries, which are mainly based on mammography, unsuitable for Chinese women. The aim of this prospective study was to compare which method, x-ray or ultrasound, is more appropriate for screening and early diagnosis of breast cancer in Chinese women.

primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, and negative predictive value of the screening methods.

secondary_outcome.description: The cost-effectiveness of each screening modality to detect one case of breast cancer

intervention.description: Patients screened by both mammography and ultrasound.

biospec_descr.textblock: Biopsy or specimen from volunteers or donors are planned to be collected

study_pop.textblock: Chinese female subjects aged 35-70 years who were asymptomatic and able to undergo ultrasound and X-rays

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent, subjects 35-70 years old, asymptomatic, able to undergo ultrasound and x-ray
Exclusion Criteria:
- Localized breast erythema and ulceration, pregnancy, lactation, after previous breast implantation, already pathologically definite breast cancer patients

overall_official.affiliation: Peking Union Medical College Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and PUMC, BJ, China

facility.name: Peking Union Medical College Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual information of each participant of the trials is not shown in public, yet can be obtained upon reasonable requirements.
